notes.name: effective name
notes.note: This taxonomic name has been effectively published but not validly published under the rules of the International Code of Nomenclature of Prokaryotes (Bacteriological Code).

notes.name: Effective Name
notes.note: This is an effectively published name.

publications.name: Skerman VBD et al. (1980)
publications.citation: Skerman, V.B.D., McGowan, V., and Sneath, P.H.A. "Approved Lists of Bacterial Names." Intl. J. Syst. Bacteriol. (1980) 30(1):225-420.

citations.full_citation: Alderton, M.R., Korolik, V., Coloe, P.J., Dewhirst, F.E., and Paster, B.J. "Campylobacter hyoilei sp. nov., associated with porcine proliferative enteritis." Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol. (1995) 45:61-66.
Stonnet, V., Harmant, C., Bizet, C., and Guesdon, J.L. "Characterization of the type strain of Campylobacter coli, CIP 70.80, by plasmid typing." Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol. (1995) 45:592-594.

Vandamme, P., Van Doorn, L.J., al Rashid, S.T., Quint, W.G., van der Plas, J., Chan, V.L., and On, S.L. "Campylobacter hyoilei Alderton et al. 1995 and Campylobacter coli Veron and Chatelain 1973 are subjective synonyms." Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol. (1997) 47:1055-1060.
Vandamme, P., and On, S.L. "Recommendations of the subcommittee on the taxonomy of Campylobacter and related bacteria." Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol. (2001) 51:719-721.
